27831 LDEQ Facility Identification



City of Alexandria Water Department

Sterkx Road Site

RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site is located at 4726 Sterkx Road, Alexandria, LA.   Chlorine used in the chlorination of the drinking water is stored at this location.  A maximum of 4,000 pounds of chlorine are stored in one ton cylinders.  The City of Alexandria Sterkx Road Site is included in written community emergency response plan.  In case of a chlorine leak, the City of Alexandria has an emergency response policy which requires City personnel to notify LA State Police Hazmat by calling the 911 center as well as local fire and police departments.  These emergency personnel are used to assist in evacuating citizens in the affected area.  Currently, the City uses daily inspection, leak detection and a comprehensive preventative maintenance program to ensure the system is operating properly.  Plant personnel have been properly trained to handle chlorine stored in one ton cylinders.  Formal and on-the-job training ensures plant personnel have the necessary knowledge and skill to properly maintain the chlorination system.  On-going operator training and preventive maintenance continue to be key tools to ensure the safety of the public.  The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site has no history of reportable release for chlorine.  There have been no injury or property loss associated with this chemical at this site. 





The following provides a description of the risk management program at the City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site. 

 

1.0  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment.  The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrates this commitment.  The City of Alexandria

Water Department Sterkx Road Site implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation, and maintenance of our processes.  Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel and local emergency agencies will respond to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.



2.0  Description of The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site and Regulated Substances



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site handles one substance regulated by the Risk Management Plan (RMP) Rule in quantities above the Threshold Quantity.



Chlorine - stored in 1 ton containers and used for disinfection of the water prior to distribution.



3.0  Hazard Assessment



The RMP Rule requires The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site to perform a Hazard Assessment of the regulated substances stored and used in the covered processes at the facility.  The Hazard Assessment includes an offsite consequence analysis for the following scenarios:



One worst-case and one alternative release scenario for the toxic substance chlorine for the chlorination process unit at the facility.



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site completed a Hazard Assessment for the covered processes and the results have been appropriately communicated to the local emergency response agencies.  The Hazard Assessment has been updated for the current RMP Re-Submission (January 2019).



4.0  Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



The RMP rule requires that a prevention program be established for The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site chlorination processes.  The following details the prevention program elements at The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site that apply to

these processes.



4.1  Safety Information



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site maintains a variety of technical documents that are used to help ensure safe operation of The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site processes.  Safety Data Sheets (SDS) document the physical and chemical properties of the hazardous substances handled at The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site, including the Chlorine in the covered process.  The engineering design documents include the operating parameters, the design basis and configuration of the equipment in each covered process, and references to applicable codes and standards.



4.2  Hazard Review



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site performs and periodically updates hazard reviews of the covered processes to help identify and control process hazards.  Checklists are used to guide the hazard review.  These checklists include items to help ensure The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site operates and maintains the equipment in a manner consistent with the applicable design specifications, codes, standards, and regulations.



4.3  Operating Procedures



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site develops and maintains operating procedures to define how tasks related to process operations should be performed.  The operating procedures are used to:



1. train employees and contractors, and

2. serve as reference guides for appropriate actions to take during normal and abnormal process conditions.



4.4  Training



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site trains personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks.  A record of all training is maintained to help ensure new and refresher training is provided on a timely basis.



4.5  Maintenance



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site properly maintains the equipment in our processes.  T

he City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site maintenance program includes:



1. procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks

2. worker training in the maintenance procedures

3. inspection and testing program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before equipment fails.



4.6  Compliance Audit



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site performs periodic (at least every three years) audits of covered processes to verify the processes are operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP rule.  A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.



4.7  Incident Investigations



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environment.  The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site trains employees to identify and report any and all incidents requiring investigation.  An investigation team is assembled and the investigation is initiated within 48 hours of the incident.  The results of the incident are documented, recommendations are resolved, and appropriate process enhancements are implemented.



4.8  Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Chlorine



Industry standards are followed at The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site to help ensure the safe handling of chlorine.  The vendor supplies chlorine via a Department of Transportation(DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton containers.  The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes.  Workers who perform operations involving chlorine receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to guidelines required by The Cit

y of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site.



5.0  Five Year Accident History



There have been no accidents or releases involving chlorine at The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site.



6.0  Emergency Response Programs



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site has prepared a written emergency response plan that complies with the RMP rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines.  This plan has been communicated to the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and local fire department.



7.0  Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site continuously attempts to improve the safety of our processes to protect the employees, the public, and the environment.  The City of Alexandria Water Department Sterkx Road Site incident investigations, employee suggestions, and improvement in technology are utilized to update the safety aspects of the processes.
